瑀字的基本解释

瑀
yǔ
像玉的石头，白色。

瑀字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yǔ］
［《廣韻》王矩切，上麌，云。］
似玉的美石。《诗·郑风·女曰鸡鸣》“雜佩以贈之”毛传：“雜佩者，珩、璜、琚、瑀、衝牙之類。”郑玄笺：“瑀，石次玉也。”一说为大珠。朱熹集传：“雜佩者，左右佩玉也。上横曰珩，下繫三組，貫以蠙珠。中組之半貫一大珠，曰瑀。末懸一玉，兩端皆鋭，曰衝牙。”

瑀字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【玉字部】　瑀； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页736第14
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?王矩切，音羽。【說文】石之似玉者。【徐曰】按詩傳：佩玉，琚瑀，以納其閒。【後漢·輿服志】乃爲大佩衝牙雙瑀璜，皆以白玉。【註】詩云：雜佩以贈之。毛萇曰：珩璜琚瑀，衝牙之類。月令章句曰：佩上有雙衡，下有雙璜，琚瑀以雜之，衝牙?珠，以納其閒。纂要曰：琚瑀，所以納閒，在玉之閒，今白珠也。 考證：〔月令章句曰，佩上有雙衝。〕　謹照原文衝改衡。

Basic explanation of words
Yu
yǔ
A stone like jade, white.
Yu
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [yǔ]
["Guangyun" Wang Juqie, Shangyu, Yun. ]
Beautiful stone like jade. "Poetry·Zheng Feng·Nv Says Chicken Cock" "Miscellaneous wear is given as a gift" Mao Chuan: "Miscellaneous wearers, Heng, Huang, Ju, Yu, Chongya, etc." Zheng Xuan Jian: "Yu, Shi Ciyu also ." One said it was a big pearl. Zhu Xi's collection: "Those who wear mixed wear also wear jade on the left and right. The upper horizontal line is called Heng, the lower line is three groups, and the bead is connected. The middle group is semi-permeated with a large bead, called 瑀. At the end hangs a jade, both ends are stunned, and said Punch your teeth."
Yu
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Wu Ji 1] [Jade Character Department] 　瑀; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 736-14
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting]? Wang Juqie, Otowa. [Said the text] The stone is like jade. 【Xu Yue】According to the biography of the poem: Peiyu, Juyu, to take leisure. [Later Han·Yufuzhi] It is for the big pierced and red teeth, both of which are made of white jade. [Note] Poetry Cloud: Miscellaneous wear for gift. Mao Chang said: Henghuang, Chongya and the like. The Yueling Zhangju said: There are double balances on the top of the wear, double Huangs on the bottom, and juxuan with mixed ones, and the teeth and beads are used for leisure. Compilation Yao said: Ju Yu, so take leisure, in the leisure of jade, now Bai Zhu is also. Research: [Yue Ling Zhang Ju said, there are double punches on the wear. 〕　I would like to change the balance according to the original text.
